<<<code>>>: $CODE
<<<explanation>>>: $EXPLANATION.
Question: How can I calculate the sum of an array in Java?
Please using this api: Arrays.stream.
Answer:<<<api>>>: Arrays.stream
<<<code>>>: int[] array = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5};
int sum = Arrays.stream(array).sum();
<<<explanation>>>: The sum() method of the IntStream class returns the sum of elements in this stream. This is a special case of a reduction. This is a terminal operation.
Question: How to parse json object in Android?: :I am trying to parse Json object which is;{   "results":[      {         "face":{            "id":361122.0,            "photo_hash":"0a2aaff34fd576fc1caf711d88cbfd53",            "x1":699,            "x2":1020,            "y1":271,            "photo":" ",            "thumbnail":" ",            "meta":"",            "timestamp":"2016-07-28T08:50:43.710183",            "y2":592         },         "confidence":0.93187      },      {         "face":{            "id":361260.0,            "photo_hash":"767bf4df0c8a04361aaf5e6b74eb4d8c",            "x1":-25,            "x2":147,            "y1":10,            "photo":" ",            "thumbnail":" ",            "meta":"",            "timestamp":"2016-07-28T15:13:09.086390",            "y2":165         },         "confidence":0.926754      }   ]}And I am using such code for parsing confidence and thumbnail :resultParams[i].confidence = jsonObject.getJSONArray("results").getJSONObject(i).getString("confidence");resultParams[i].thumbnail = jsonObject.getJSONArray("results").getJSONObject(i).getJSONObject("face").getString("thumbnail");However it gives exception "java.lang.NullPointerException: Attempt to write to field  on a null object reference"Could you please help me how to successfully parse it?
Please using this api: JsonElement.getAsString.
Answer:
response:
<<<api>>>: JsonElement.getAsString
<<<code>>>: String json = "{\n" +
"    \"results\": [\n" +
"        {\n" +
"            \"face\": {\n" +
"                \"id\": 361122.0,\n" +
"                \"photo_hash\": \"0a2aaff34fd576fc1caf711d88cbfd53\",\n" +
"                \"x1\": 699,\n" +
"                \"x2\": 1020,\n" +
"                \"y1\": 271,\n" +
"                \"photo\": \"\",\n" +
"                \"thumbnail\": \"\",\n" +
"                \"meta\": \"\",\n" +
"                \"timestamp\": \"2016-07-28T08:50:43.710183\",\n" +
"                \"y2\": 592\n" +
"            },\n" +
"            \"confidence\": 0.93187\n" +
"        },\n" +
"        {\n" +
"            \"face\": {\n" +
"                \"id\": 361260.0,\n" +
"                \"photo_hash\": \"767bf4df0c8a04361aaf5e6b74eb4d8c\",\n" +
"                \"x1\": -25,\n" +
"                \"x2\": 147,\n" +
"                \"y1\": 10,\n" +
"                \"photo\": \"\",\n" +
"                \"thumbnail\": \"\",\n" +
"                \"meta\": \"\",\n" +
"                \"timestamp\": \"2016-07-28T15:13:09.086390\",\n" +
"                \"y2\": 165\n" +
"            }\n" +
"        },\n" +
"    ]\n" +
"}";
JsonObject jsonObject = new JsonParser().parse(json).getAsJsonObject();
JsonArray results = jsonObject.getAsJsonArray("results");
JsonObject resultParams = new JsonObject();
for (int i = 0; i < results.size(); i++) {
    JsonObject result = results.get(i).getAsJsonObject();
    resultParams.addProperty("confidence", result.get("confidence").getAsDouble());
    resultParams.addProperty("thumbnail", result.get("face").get("thumbnail").getAsString());
}
System.out.println(resultParams.toString());

Question: How to get the value of a key in a JSON object?
Please using this api: JsonObject.get(String).
Answer:<<<api>>>: JsonObject.get(String)
<<<code>>>: JsonObject jsonObject = new JsonParser().parse(json).getAsJsonObject();
String confidence = jsonObject.get("confidence").getAsString();
String thumbnail = jsonObject.get("face").get("thumbnail").getAsString();
System.out.println(confidence);
System.out.println(thumbnail);
